channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Waymo is asking DoorDash drivers to shut the doors of its self-driving cars
item.description: If a passenger accidentally leaves a Waymo door open, the vehicle can get stuck in place.

item.title: Google says Android 17 is still 'coming soon' – here are the 5 biggest features to look forward to
item.description: Android 17's first beta didn't land when expected, but it's still "coming soon" according to Google, and it could include some major new features.

item.title: Want two Google Pixel phones for the price of one? Optus is giving away a Pixel 9a with every Pixel 10 series signup
item.description: With Google officially confirming the Pixel 10a will be coming soon, Optus is clearing out its stock of the 9a via this two-for-one deal, with plans starting at AU$92.46 per month.

item.title: Ring calls off partnership with police surveillance provider Flock Safety
item.description: Ring has canceled its partnership with Flock Safety, after receiving backlash for running a Super Bowl ad touting its Search Party feature. If you’ll recall, Ring revealed back in October 2025 that it was entering a partnership with the surveillance company, which would make it possible for law enforcement to ask smart doorbell owners for videos captured by their devices. In its announcement, the company said that the “planned Flock Safety integration would require significantly more time and resources than anticipated.” The decision to call off the partnership was mutual, Ring added, and Flo...

item.title: NYT Connections hints today: Clues, answers for February 13, 2026
item.description: Connections is a New York Times word game that's all about finding the "common threads between words." How to solve the puzzle.

item.title: NYT Strands hints, answers for February 13, 2026
item.description: The NYT Strands hints and answers you need to make the most of your puzzling experience.

item.title: Wordle today: Answer, hints for February 13, 2026
item.description: Here's the answer for "Wordle" #1700 on February 13 as well as a few hints, tips, and clues to help you solve it yourself.
